description: Construction of part single part two storey rear extension to accommodate a ground floor retail unit with associated servicing access/refuse storage; and a studio flat at first floor.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number PL22E received 28th June 2013, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local Planning Authority.  Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building.  Reason: To ensure that the materials and finishes are of high quality and contribute positively to the visual amenity of the locality in accordance with section 7 of the National Planning Policy Framework, policies 7.4 and 7.6 7.8 of the London Plan 2011, policy 4.1and 5.5 of the Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), policy 1.1 (g), of the Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy, policy 7.B of the emerging Ealing's Development Management Development Plan Document. | The retial use hereby permitted shall not operate outside 8am to 8pm Mondays to Saturdays, and 8am to 6pm Sundays or Public Holidays.  REASON:	In the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.11, 5.5 and 7.4 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and policies 1.1(g), 2.1 (c) and 2.10 of the Adopted Development (or Core) Strategy and policies 7.1 and 7.4 of The London Plan 'Spatial Development Strategy for Greater London' (July 2011) and policy 7.A of the emerging Ealing's Development Management Development Plan Document. | Deliveries and waste collections for the retail unit hereby approved shall only take place during the period 0800 - 2000 hrs on Mondays to Saturdays and at no time on Sundays and Public Holidays.  REASON: In the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties in accordance with policies 4.1, 5.5, 4.11 and 7.4 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and policies 1.1(g), 2.1 (c) and 2.10 of the Adopted Development (or Core) Strategy and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of The London Plan 'Spatial Development Strategy for Greater London' (July 2011). | The refuse bin stores shown on the approved drawings shall be completed and made available before the development hereby approved is first occupied and thereafter retained in perpetuity. They shall have individual locks and be designated as shown in approved drawing SOUTH/PL22E.  REASON: To ensure that adequate provision for refuse storage is made within the site, in accordance with policy 5.17 of The London Plan 2011, policies 2.10 and 4.1of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), policies 1.1(g), 2.1 (c) and 2.10 of the Adopted Development (or Core) Strategy and Supplementary Planning Guidance 4 'Refuse and recycling facilities'. | The development hereby approved shall comply with 'Secured by Design' standards.  REASON: To ensure that the development incorporates crime prevention measures to help prevent crime and disorder and to improve pedestrian accessibility in accordance with policies 4.1, & 4.3 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), policies 1.1 (e) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy LV 7.3 of the Ealing Draft Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policy 7.3 of the London Plan (2011). | The residential unit hereby approved shall be constructed to the lifetime homes standards, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.  REASON: To ensure that the development is accessible by all future occupiers, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.3 and 5.3 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), SPG 7, the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7.2 of the London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | The retail unit hereby approved shall be used for retail use only (A1 use class) and for no other purposes within the schedule to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 (or any subsequent order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modifications) without the prior written permission of the local planning authority obtained through the submission of a planning application.  REASON:  To restrict the use of the premises to one compatible with the surrounding area, and to enable the local planning authority to maintain strict control over the nature of the use in the interests of the function of the town centre and residential amenity of neighbouring properties  in accordance with policy 7.4 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), policy 1.1(j) and 2.10  the Ealing Core Strategy (2012),  policies 2.15, 4.7, 4.9 of The London Plan 2011, and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | Notwithstanding any information submitted with the application and prior to the commencement of the development hereby approved, details shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval for the insulation of the building envelope, with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided which will achieve required internal criteria for sensitive rooms.  The details should also include the provision of alternative means of ventilation, all in accordance with Authority's criteria.  The works should be completed before occupation and permanently retained thereafter.  REASON: In the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties and future occupiers of the development, in accordance with policies 2.6, 4.1 and 4.11 of the Adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), Supplmentary Planning Guidance 10 @Noise nad Vibration', policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Draft Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policies 7.14 and 7.15 of the London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | No part of the roof of the extension shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.  REASON: In the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties in accordance with policies 4.1, 5.5, 4.11 and 7.4 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and policies 1.1(g), 2.1 (c) and 2.10 of the Adopted Development (or Core) Strategy and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of The London Plan 'Spatial Development Strategy for Greater London' (July 2011). | A delivery/servicing operational management plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to the first occupation of the retial unit hereby approved. The information hsall include the servicing of  the existing ground floor retial unit  The development shall be implemented and operated only in accordance with the approved details, and shall be permanently retained thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.   REASON: In the interests of highway/pedestrian safety  and an apporpriate opration of commercial premises within the site,  in accordance with policies 4.1, 9.1 and 9.9 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), policies 1.1(e) (j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies LV 7.A, of the Ealing Draft Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 6.11, 6.12 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
